front.title: A SASL Mechanism for SAML Enhanced Clients

abstract.t: Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) 2.0 is a generalizedframework for the exchange of security-related information betweenasserting and relying parties. Simple Authentication and SecurityLayer (SASL) is an application framework to facilitate an extensibleauthentication model. This document specifies a SASL mechanism forSAML 2.0 that leverages the capabilities of a SAML- aware "enhancedclient" to address significant barriers to federated authenticationin a manner that encourages reuse of existing SAML bindings andprofiles designed for non-browser scenarios.
